com.crawljax.core.configuration

Class CrawlSpecification

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.crawljax.core.configuration.CrawlSpecification

  • public class CrawlSpecification
extends Object
    Specifies the crawl options for a single crawl session. The user must specify which HTML elements should be clicked during the crawl session.

    The scope can be restricted using setDepth(int)and setMaximumStates(int).
    The duration can be restricted using setMaximumRuntime(int).

    By default Crawljax fills in random values for input fields setRandomInputInForms(boolean).
    Specific input for form elements can be defined with setInputSpecification(InputSpecification).
    Default values: Maximum runtime: 3600 seconds
    Time to wait after initial pageload: 500 milliseconds
    Time to wait after clicking HTML elements: 500 milliseconds
    Enter random form input data: true

    EXAMPLE:
    CrawlSpecification crawler = new CrawlSpecification("http://www.google.com");
    //click these elements
    crawler.click("a");
    crawler.click("input").withAttribute("type", "submit");
    onLoginPageCondition = new UrlCondition("#login");
    crawler.when(onLoginPageCondition).click("a").withText("Login");
    //but don't click these
    crawler.dontClick("a").underXpath("//DIV[@id='guser']"); crawler.dontClick("a").withText("Language Tools");
    //restrict the scope of the crawling
    crawler.setCrawlMaximumStates(15);
    crawler.setCrawlDepth(2);

    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    DannyRoest@gmail.com (Danny Roest)

    • Method Detail

      • clickDefaultElements

        public void clickDefaultElements()
        Specifies that Crawljax should click all the default clickable elements. These include: All anchor tags All buttons

      • clickMoreElements

        public void clickMoreElements()
        Guifre Ruiz: This method can be used to crawl more tags and, therefore, more pages in the target. However, it slow down a bit the process.

      • click

        public CrawlElement click(String tagName)
        Set of HTML elements Crawljax will click during crawling For exmple 1) 2)
        click("a") will only include 1 This set can be restricted by dontClick(String).
        Parameters:
        tagName - the tag name of the elements to be included
        Returns:
        this CrawlElement

      • dontClick

        public CrawlElement dontClick(String tagName)
        Set of HTML elements Crawljax will NOT examine during crawling When an HTML is present in the click and dontClick sets, then the element will not be clicked. For example: 1) Some text 2) 3)
        click("a") dontClick("a").withAttribute("class", "foo"); Will include only include HTML element 2
        Parameters:
        tagName - the tag name of the elements to be excluded
        Returns:
        this CrawlElement

      • when

        public CrawlActions when(Condition... conditions)
        Crawljax will the HTML elements while crawling if and only if all the specified conditions are satisfied. IMPORTANT: only works with click()!!! For example: when(onContactPageCondition) will only click the HTML element if it is on the contact page
        Parameters:
        conditions - the condition to be met.
        Returns:
        this CrawlActions

      • setDepth

        public void setDepth(int crawlDepth)
        Sets the maximum crawl depth. 1 is one click, 2 is two clicks deep, ...
        Parameters:
        crawlDepth - the maximum crawl depth. 0 to ignore

      • setMaximumStates

        public void setMaximumStates(int crawlMaximumStates)
        Sets the maximum number of states. Crawljax will stop crawling when this maximum number of states are found
        Parameters:
        crawlMaximumStates - the maximum number of states. 0 specifies no bound for the number of crawl states.

        Parameters:
